docs.snippet: MERCEDES, Uruguay, May 30 --An American who has successfully bridged the temperamental gap between Paul's Valley, Okla., and this agricultural center in southwestern Uruguay drove off through the mud yesterday on the first leg of a 7,500-mile journey...
docs.lead_paragraph: MERCEDES, Uruguay, May 30 --An American who has successfully bridged the temperamental gap between Paul's Valley, Okla., and this agricultural center in southwestern Uruguay drove off through the mud yesterday on the first leg of a 7,500-mile journey to the University of Wisconsin, where he will study for a year on a State Department scholarship.
docs.abstract: Montevideo embassy attache H Maness to study at Wis Univ on State Dept scholarship

headline.main: OKLAHOMAN WINS FAME IN URUGUAY; U.S. Embassy Attache Leaves on Graduate Scholarship After Aiding Ranchers

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 3 --The United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America, which is the youngest of three such regional bodies, will start its third annual meeting here tomorrow.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 4--The "enormous social responsibility" of the handful of United States newsreel producers in the era of the "cold war" is stressed in "World Newsreels," a study by the United Nations' Educational, Scientific and Cultural...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 4--The "enormous social responsibility" of the handful of United States newsreel producers in the era of the "cold war" is stressed in "World Newsreels," a study by the United Nations' Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, made public here today.
docs.abstract: State control and propaganda use in various countries revealed; need for US newsreels in 'cold war' stressed, UNESCO survey; W Farr comments
